body: IIUC, this is handling the case when `skip_empty` is true and the delimiter is the first or last character. But what about cases where there are multiple consecutive delimiters? See comment about testing (and perhaps duplicating/reusing `testStringSplitWithNoSkipEmpty` with this new op)
body_html: IIUC, this is handling the case when skip_empty is true and the delimiter is the first or last character. But what about cases where there are multiple consecutive delimiters? See comment about testing (and perhaps duplicating/reusing testStringSplitWithNoSkipEmpty with this new op)
body_text: IIUC, this is handling the case when skip_empty is true and the delimiter is the first or last character. But what about cases where there are multiple consecutive delimiters? See comment about testing (and perhaps duplicating/reusing testStringSplitWithNoSkipEmpty with this new op)
